text: Indo-Turks in Turkey or in Turkish: ("Hint asıllı Türkler"), are the descendant of Muslim Indian-Merchant's of the Middle class who's Ancestors once came in weaves from British India arround 1750-1857,https://dergipark.org.tr/en/download/article-file/1717482 especially after the fall of the Mughal Empire like the Indian Rebellion of 1857 and Murree rebellion of 1857, also again from 1876-1924 and settled in the Ottoman Empire and Turkey.https://core.ac.uk/download/pdf/144518161.pdf There was several Muslim Indian Soldiers and Doctors who went from India to the Ottoman Empire at the time of Balkan Wars and World War I. The most prominent person of them was Abdurrahman Peshawari a Hero in the Turkey's War of Independence. Indo Turks, today speak Turkish language and fully assimilated in the Turkish culture,https://dergipark.org.tr/en/download/article-file/2512649 but are often mistakenly thought to be Roma people. Indo-Turkic relations traces back to Medival Times.https://dergipark.org.tr/en/download/article-file/2512649 ==References== Category:Ethnic groups in Turkey
title: Indo-Turkic people
